headline.main: Daimler Opens Internal Emissions Probe at U.S. Request
headline.print_headline: Daimler Opens Internal Emissions Probe at U.S. Request

docs.snippet: German automaker Daimler AG said late Thursday it is conducting an internal investigation of its certification process for diesel exhaust emissions in the United States at the request of the Justice Department....
docs.lead_paragraph: German automaker Daimler AG said late Thursday it is conducting an internal investigation of its certification process for diesel exhaust emissions in the United States at the request of the Justice Department.

headline.main: Rio Games Will Deliver, Says U.S. Water Polo Captain
headline.print_headline: Rio Games Will Deliver, Says U.S. Water Polo Captain

docs.snippet: Pessimism about the success of this year's Rio Games is misplaced, says U.S. water polo captain Tony Azevedo, who is confident that Brazilians will once again prove they have few peers when it comes to hosting a party....
docs.lead_paragraph: Pessimism about the success of this year's Rio Games is misplaced, says U.S. water polo captain Tony Azevedo, who is confident that Brazilians will once again prove they have few peers when it comes to hosting a party.

headline.main: Texas Woman Killed Self With Children in Car: Police
headline.print_headline: Texas Woman Killed Self With Children in Car: Police

docs.snippet: A woman from a Dallas suburb who was found dead inside her sport-utility vehicle with her three children alive in the back seat committed suicide, police said on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A woman from a Dallas suburb who was found dead inside her sport-utility vehicle with her three children alive in the back seat committed suicide, police said on Thursday.

headline.main: Japan Eyes Double-Barrelled Stimulus to Ease Yen Strains
headline.print_headline: Japan Eyes Double-Barrelled Stimulus to Ease Yen Strains

docs.snippet: Japan looks increasingly likely to fire both fiscal and monetary barrels in the coming weeks to help recovery and arrest unwelcome gains in the yen, with direct currency intervention off the table after a cool reception from its U.S. ally....
docs.lead_paragraph: Japan looks increasingly likely to fire both fiscal and monetary barrels in the coming weeks to help recovery and arrest unwelcome gains in the yen, with direct currency intervention off the table after a cool reception from its U.S. ally.

headline.main: In China's Shadow, SE Asia Looks to Replace Aging Fighter Jets
headline.print_headline: In China's Shadow, SE Asia Looks to Replace Aging Fighter Jets

docs.snippet: With an eye on China's more muscular stance in the South China Sea, Southeast Asian governments are stepping up efforts to replace aging fighter aircraft fleets, paving the way for multi-billion dollar deals in a boon for warplane makers....
docs.lead_paragraph: With an eye on China's more muscular stance in the South China Sea, Southeast Asian governments are stepping up efforts to replace aging fighter aircraft fleets, paving the way for multi-billion dollar deals in a boon for warplane makers.

headline.main: Clemson Students End 8-Day Diversity Sit-In Protest
headline.print_headline: Clemson Students End 8-Day Diversity Sit-In Protest

docs.snippet: Clemson University students say they are ending their sit-in protest over a lack of diversity on campus....
docs.lead_paragraph: Clemson University students say they are ending their sit-in protest over a lack of diversity on campus.
